asfbot build

Hi Andrew,

I think what happened is this:


   - I forked your repo.
   -  A little while after, but before branching for my actual change, I
   attempted to sync my fork following the instructions here:
   https://help.github.com/articles/syncing-a-fork/. I pushed the changes
   to my github fork after the merge - this appears to have assigned all new
   commit ids for each of the commits that were merged from your upstream repo
   during the sync to my local copy of my fork.
   - I created my branch and made the single commit I wanted to have pulled.
   - I created the pull request not realizing that I had actually created
   all of those additional, redundant, commits during the sync. It is these
   commits that I could not figure out how to get rid of.

It looks like my pull request was accepted and I hope that I have not
messed anything up in the process :-(

I think I need to find a better way to keep my fork up to date with the
upstream version such that I don't have re-commits of all the commits that
were made on your fork. Any suggestions you have would be appreciated.

Best Regards,

Lynne Lawrence
